title: MS AccessIsNumeric()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessIsNumeric()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Check whether the expression is a valid number:
SELECT IsNumeric(1030);

Definition and Usage
The IsNumeric() function checks whether an expression is a valid number.
This function returns a Boolean value. TRUE (-1) indicates that the 
expression is a valid number, and FALSE (0) indicates that the expression is not 
a valid number.
Syntax
IsNumeric(
expression
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
expression
Required. The value to test
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000
More Examples
Example
Return TRUE if the expression is a valid number, otherwise FALSE:
SELECT IsNumeric("Hello");

Example
Return TRUE if the expression is a valid number, otherwise FALSE:
SELECT IsNumeric("1030");

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessIsNumeric()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessIsNumeric()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessIsNumeric()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
